content.description:
You won’t have enough time for everything so make time for the things that matter.

Time ascends the grey hourglass shaped slab that is the namesake of this section of the cliff and the largest contiguous feature in the whole of the Farmhouse. Begin on the ledge below the slab (accessed by climbing The Beginning of Time). Then crawl your way up delicate and demanding intro climbing to a no-hands rest in the notch of the hourglass. Climb and up and right from the notch to gain a series of amazing features leading straight up the middle of the slab. A short and challenging traverse left awaits those who pull through the last crux. This traverse puts you onto slightly lower angle terrain with four somewhat spacey bolts that lead to the top of the wall.  The belayer can run a long tether up to the first draw and out left to the anchors for ‘The Beginning of Time’ in order to belay from a standing stance with the ability to provide a dynamic catch. There will be improvements to the belay ledge in the future.
content.protection: 20ish? Bolts to anchors. A 70m rope will NOT make it from the first belay ledge to the top and back down. You can climb the route with a 70m rope but when you are lowering you will have to stop at the anchors in the notch of the hourglass to untie and pull the rope. You can also break the pitch up into two separate pitches using these anchors. It wouldn't really change the grade of the route much since this spot is a no hands rest on the climb anyway but the ascent would certainly be less epic and belaying from the notch is very annoying.
content.location: Access the pitch by climbing ‘The Beginning of Time’ to gain the ledge at the base of the hourglass shaped slab.

content.description: Scramble to a high first bolt and then follow the chert-rich arête straight up through a couple of bulges. This is the approach pitch to the Hourglass Ledge.
content.protection: 12ish bolts to 2 bare hangars for anchors
content.location: This pitch ascends the arête directly below the large grey slab shaped like an hourglass.

content.description: The Hourglass is the 45 meter tall, dark grey slab on the North side of The Prow. The feature is accessed by a 30 meter approach pitch that is extremely fun in its own right (albeit it still needs some cleaning). The approach pitch leaves you on a ledge that is pretty comfortable to belay from and can host a party of 3 reasonably comfortably.
